posts.author: magpie45
posts.content:
Ok,Charles Stross,invented the Githyanki/slaad etc and a fine writer,imho,his Laundry series beats the Dresden files any day.

At the back of one of his books,his helper gets sucked into a copy of NWN he has running on his office pc,he has too go in and rescue him etc..nice little thing if you read it .

However,his char is a Cleric/sorc...HUH?

This has been nagging me to no end!,I can see it if he has PRC,but normal NWN?

Yeah I know he maybe just threw that out,but I thought I would open it up too the people here and see what you can possibly come up with,hey I can E-mail him the results!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Tough one indeed, stat-wise, but I could see a Cleric Sorc Bard or Cleric Sorc PM (although Cleric Bard PM is better).

What you could do to get started on your search (which I can't do here cuz the internet is too slow) is to run the Build's Search Engine with said inputs and see what pops up.

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
Using the search engine, I came up with 4 toons that have a minimum of 16 levels in both cleric and sorc.

Mystra's Devotee cleric 16 / monk 1 / sorcerer 23 (human) by Mithdradates
Planar Guardian cleric 16 / sorcerer 23 / monk 1 (human) by Wildeyes
The All-Star Protector Caster cleric 20 / sorcerer 19 / monk 1 (human?) by PrionViver
Divine Axe Finger Wriggler cleric 16 / sorcerer 17 / red dragon disciple 7 (human) by liquid-siphon


In case you didn't know, search engine is found here


Conlaoch

posts.author: magpie45
posts.content: Cool stuff1,hey this spread could rock a low lvl server!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: No matter what you do, it's always gonna be better with Wizard, because of the extra feats, which you can use to get your INT up and save more stat increases for DEX, ending up on a much higher AB and AC. Also, Sor 23 M 2 Cler 15 seems like a better spread than all of the suggested here.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
magpie45 wrote:...his helper gets sucked into a copy of NWN he has running on his office pc,he has too go in and rescue him etc..nice little thing if you read it .

However,his char is a Cleric/sorc...HUH?
What does the story say about how he rescued his helper?
That will help a lot when determining what to focus on whith the build, stat-, feat- and skillwise. And how did he fight, if at all? The class combo screams spellslinger, but with cleric you always have physical combat or "spellsword" as an option.
